definition: to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
point of a spear/edge of a tool/vanguard/forward (in sports team)

sentences.english: John was the forerunner to Jesus.
sentences.chinese: 施洗約翰是耶穌的開路先鋒。

sentences.english: The revolutionist is the trailblazer who moves the society forward.
sentences.chinese: 革命者是推動社會前進的開路先鋒。

sentences.english: John was beheaded by Herod the tetrarch.
sentences.chinese: 施洗約翰是耶穌的開路先鋒。

sentences.english: John would be the forerunner for Jesus.
sentences.chinese: 約翰將做耶穌的開路先鋒。

sentences.english: He is a pioneer and trailblazer.
sentences.chinese: 他是先驅者和開路先鋒。

definition: amphibious/dual-talented/able to work in two different lines
(of friends or partners) to share both the honor and the disgrace (idiom)
(idiom) to freely air one's views/to be heard far and wide/to attract a lot of attention

pinyin: duo1 yuan2 wen2 hua4 zhu3 yi4

definition: the four great Chinese inventions: paper, printing, magnetic compass and gunpowder
lit. to draw a gourd from the model (idiom)/fig. to copy sth mechanically without attempt at originality
